Content.Title: Through the Night
Content.Synopsis: Susan Sharpe features the Lindberg brothers in concert with the Stockholm Baroque Ensemble, plus works by Castello, Mendelssohn and Sweelinck.

Content.Title: Through the Night
Content.Synopsis: Susan Sharpe features Mahler's Symphony of a thousand, plus music by Rossi, Telemann, Frescobaldi, Vartabed, Delius, Lassus and Passereau.

Content.Title: Through the Night
Content.Synopsis: Susan Sharpe continues Through the Night with music from Dalza, Vivaldi, Halvorsen, Herbert and Murray.

Content.Title: Through the Night
Content.Synopsis: Susan Sharpe concludes Through the Night with music from DÃ¼tsch, Schoenberg, Schoek, Fabritius, De Heredia, Mozart, Reger, Hoffmann and Byrd.

Content.Title: Morning on 3
Content.Synopsis: Martin Handley hosts music by Schumann, Bach/Busoni and Tchaikovsky.

Content.Title: The Cowan Collection
Content.Synopsis: Rob Cowan introduces some of his favourite recordings, including music by Rameau and Purcell. Regular features include The Innocent Ear, and Rob's recommendation for a Bargain Hunter CD.

Content.Title: Musical New Year
Content.Synopsis: An International Celebration: Rob Cowan hosts a day of special concerts from around the world to mark the arrival of 2006, starting with Vienna.

Content.Title: Musical New Year
Content.Synopsis: An International Celebration: Rob Cowan continues a day of special concerts from around the world, including Sydney, Berlin, Paris and Washington, to mark the arrival of 2006.

Content.Title: Drama on 3
Content.Synopsis: The Club, by Gregory Whitehead. At the height of the American 'Gilded Age', members of an elegant New England social and croquet club performed an elaborate if somewhat distasteful ritual.

Content.Title: Sunday Feature
Content.Synopsis: In Search of Hans Christian Andersen: Another chance to hear Michael Rosen and Lars Tharp's visit to Denmark to uncover the truth about the unlikely creator of some our best loved tales.

Content.Title: Andy Kershaw
Content.Synopsis: Rock legend Robert Plant brings his band The Strange Sensation in to the BBC's Maida Vale studios for an exclusive session, featuring songs from their album The Mighty Rearranger.
